sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The Jolly Welsh-woman who drinking at the sign of the Crown in London, found a spring in her mugg, for joy of which hur sung the praise of old England, resolving never to return to Wales again : tune of, Hey brave popery, &c.
1 broadside : ill.
Printed for P. Brooksby, J. Deacon, J. Blare, and J. Back, [London] : [between 1688 and 1692]
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing. "Licensed according to order." Illustrated with 4 woodcuts. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
=======
